title: Academic Research Site Performance Tracker
description: Upload and analyze multi-site academic research data collection reports to monitor recruitment, protocol adherence, and operational issues with validation and summary feedback.
inputLabel: Paste or upload your site data report (CSV or XLSX) or enter JSON metadata/issue log
outputLabel: Summary, validation feedback, and insights on site data quality and performance
systemPrompt: You are a strict assistant for academic multi-site research data managers. Accept only CSV or XLSX file uploads or JSON text input representing site data reports, site metadata updates, or issue logs. Validate input format and required fields strictly: siteId, studyId, reportDate, recruitmentCount must be present for reports; unique issueId, siteId, reportedDate, description for issue logs; valid siteId for metadata updates. Reject any input with personal or medical data or out-of-scope requests. Return detailed, user-friendly validation errors or a success summary. Output only plain text. Do not generate any confidential or participant-level data. Enforce strict data privacy and do not process unauthorized requests.

presets.label: Validate Site Data Report
presets.prompt: Validate the uploaded CSV or XLSX site data report for required fields and data quality. Provide detailed row-level validation errors or confirm acceptance.
presets.hint: Use this when uploading periodic site collection reports.

presets.label: Validate and Store Site Metadata
presets.prompt: Validate the JSON input as site metadata update with valid siteId and coordinators/equipment lists. Return validation errors or confirmation of acceptance.
presets.hint: Use this for manual metadata updates.

presets.label: Validate Issue Log Submission
presets.prompt: Validate the JSON input as an issue log with unique issueId, siteId, reportedDate, and description. Return errors if invalid or confirm acceptance.
presets.hint: Use this to submit incident or operational issue reports.

presets.label: Summarize Site Data Upload Outcome
presets.prompt: After upload, summarize the site data report quality, highlight missing or inconsistent data, and suggest next steps for correction or follow-up.
presets.hint: Use this to get actionable feedback after uploading.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, output JSON with fields: success (boolean), errors (array of {row: number, field: string, message: string}), summary (string).
clarifyPrompt: Please provide the uploaded file or paste the JSON data for site reports, metadata, or issue logs. Specify the data type if possible (e.g., 'site report', 'metadata', 'issue log').
finalizePrompt: Confirm that the uploaded data or input is complete and valid for processing. Provide a summary of validation results and next recommended actions.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Data Collection Site Performance Tracker

niche.scenario: Managing and optimizing data collection performance across multiple geographic data collection sites during large-scale academic studies

idea.problem: Academic research data managers overseeing multi-site studies struggle to monitor, compare, and optimize data collection quality, participant recruitment rates, protocol adherence, and operational issues across sites using fragmented manual reports and spreadsheets. This leads to delays, inconsistencies, and compliance risks.
inputs: Periodic site data collection reports (uploaded as CSV, XLSX, or manually entered data)
Site metadata (location, responsible coordinators, equipment lists)
Issue and incident logs submitted by site staff
outputs: Interactive dashboard showing site-by-site performance metrics and trends
Automated alerts on sites falling behind recruitment or with protocol deviations
Prioritized action item lists for follow-up with specific sites
Exportable compliance status summaries for funders and ethics boards
whyItWins: Transforms fragmented, manual site reporting into a centralized, data-driven performance monitoring system
Enables proactive identification and resolution of data collection bottlenecks and compliance issues
Supports repeated use throughout study duration with ongoing data input and updated outputs
Reduces management overhead and risk of costly study delays or data quality problems
Tailored specifically to academic multi-site research workflows, distinct from single-site compliance or protocol tools

upgradePath.today: A lightweight web app to upload periodic site reports and generate summary dashboards and alerts
upgradePath.in90Days: Add multi-user collaboration features, manual data entry forms, and customizable metric tracking per study protocol
upgradePath.in12Months: Full multi-page system with secure user roles for site coordinators and central managers, real-time data integration from site databases, advanced analytics with predictive risk scoring, and automated compliance documentation exports

riskNotes: Ensure strict data privacy and access controls due to sensitive participant and site operational data
Avoid medical or personal diagnosis functions; focus on operational and compliance metrics only
Require user training for consistent data input to maintain output accuracy
Address potential variability in data format and quality across sites with robust validation

blueprint.summary: A centralized web platform for academic research data managers to upload, monitor, and optimize multi-site data collection performance through dashboards, alerts, and standardized reports.
successMetrics: Reduction in delays caused by data quality or compliance issues
Increased completeness and timeliness of site data submissions
User adoption rate among site coordinators and central managers
Number of proactive alerts generated and resolved
Accuracy and usefulness of performance comparison reports

components.name: Dashboard UI
components.responsibility: Display interactive site performance metrics, trends, alerts, and reports to users.
notes: Supports filtering by study, site, and date range.
Visualizes recruitment, protocol adherence, and issue logs.
Handles empty or incomplete data gracefully.

components.name: Data Entry UI
components.responsibility: Allow manual input and upload of site reports, metadata, checklists, and issue logs.
notes: Supports CSV/XLSX upload with validation feedback.
Manual forms for incremental data entry.
Role-based access controls for site coordinators.

components.name: Site Data API
components.responsibility: Handle ingestion, validation, storage, and retrieval of site data collection reports and metadata.
notes: Validates data format and completeness on upload.
Normalizes data from different file formats.
Supports querying by site, date, and study.

components.name: Alerts API
components.responsibility: Generate and serve alerts for recruitment shortfalls, protocol deviations, and operational issues.
notes: Supports alert acknowledgement and resolution tracking.
Configurable alert thresholds per study protocol.

components.name: Reports API
components.responsibility: Generate standardized site performance comparison reports and compliance summaries.
notes: Supports export to PDF and CSV formats.
Handles report generation on-demand and scheduled.

components.name: Site Reports Data Store
components.responsibility: Persist site data collection reports, recruitment stats, and protocol adherence checklists.
notes: Stores raw uploaded data and normalized records.
Includes metadata linking reports to sites and studies.

components.name: Site Metadata Store
components.responsibility: Persist site details including location, coordinators, and equipment lists.
notes: Supports updates by authorized users.
Used for filtering and reporting.

components.name: Issue Logs Store
components.responsibility: Persist operational issues and incident reports submitted by site staff.
notes: Includes timestamps, severity, and resolution status.
Supports linking to alerts and reports.

components.name: Alerts Store
components.responsibility: Persist generated alerts with status and history.
notes: Supports querying by site, type, and resolution status.

components.name: Alert Generation Job
components.responsibility: Periodically analyze site data to identify recruitment shortfalls, protocol deviations, and operational risks, generating alerts.
notes: Runs daily or on configurable schedule.
Handles missing or delayed data gracefully.

dataModels.name: SiteReport
dataModels.purpose: Store normalized data collection reports per site and period.

dataModels.name: SiteMetadata
dataModels.purpose: Store static and semi-static metadata about each site.

dataModels.name: IssueLog
dataModels.purpose: Record operational issues and incidents reported by sites.

dataModels.name: Alert
dataModels.purpose: Store alerts generated for sites regarding performance or compliance issues.

pages.title: Site Performance Dashboard
pages.purpose: Provide an overview of site performance metrics, trends, and active alerts.
inputs: filter by study, site, date range

pages.title: Upload Site Reports
pages.purpose: Allow users to upload periodic site data reports in CSV or XLSX formats.

pages.title: Manual Data Entry
pages.purpose: Enable manual input of site metadata, protocol adherence checklists, and issue logs.
inputs: forms for metadata, checklists, issue logs

pages.title: Performance Reports
pages.purpose: Generate and download standardized site comparison and compliance reports.
inputs: filter by study, site, date range

pages.title: Alerts Management
pages.purpose: View, acknowledge, and resolve alerts related to site performance and compliance.
inputs: filter by site, alert type, status
outputs: alert list with status and details

apiRoutes.purpose: Receive and process uploaded site data reports.
apiRoutes.requestShape: Multipart form-data with file and metadata fields

apiRoutes.purpose: Retrieve normalized site data reports for dashboard and reports.
apiRoutes.requestShape: Query parameters for siteId, studyId, date range

apiRoutes.purpose: Fetch site metadata for selection and display.
Submit new issue or incident logs from site staff.
Generate site performance or compliance reports.
apiRoutes.requestShape: Report parameters including sites, date range, report type
apiRoutes.responseShape: Report file URL or download stream

backgroundJobs.name: Daily Alert Generation
backgroundJobs.purpose: Analyze site data to generate alerts for recruitment shortfalls, protocol deviations, and operational issues.

edgeCases: Uploaded data files with inconsistent or missing fields
Delayed or missing periodic data submissions from sites
Conflicting or duplicate issue logs submitted by site staff
Users uploading data with incorrect site or study identifiers
Simultaneous edits to site metadata causing race conditions
Alerts generated from incomplete or partial data leading to false positives
User attempts to access data or reports without proper authorization
nonGoals: Providing medical or personal diagnosis or participant-level health data analysis
Replacing specialized protocol management or electronic data capture systems
Real-time integration with site databases in the initial release (planned for long-term upgrade)
Advanced predictive analytics and AI-driven risk scoring in the initial version
Handling participant consent management or ethics board approvals

dataFlow: User accesses /dashboard with filters (study, site, date range) → Dashboard UI calls /api/site-data/query, /api-alerts, /api-reports to fetch normalized site reports, active alerts, and reports → UI renders charts, tables, and alert summaries.

User uploads site reports via /data-entry/upload → Data Entry UI sends multipart form-data to /api/site-data/upload → Site Data API validates, normalizes, and stores data in Site Reports Data Store → Returns validation feedback and confirmation to UI.

User manually enters metadata, checklists, or issue logs via /data-entry/manual → Data Entry UI sends JSON data to /api/site-metadata (for metadata updates) or /api/issue-logs (for issue logs) → APIs validate and store data in Site Metadata Store or Issue Logs Store → UI receives validation messages and confirmation.
User views alerts at /alerts → Alerts UI calls /api/alerts with filters → Alerts API queries Alerts Store and returns alert list → UI displays alerts with status and details.

User acknowledges or resolves alerts → Alerts UI sends alert ID and resolution status to /api/alerts/acknowledge → Alerts API updates Alerts Store and returns updated alert record → UI updates alert status.

User generates reports at /reports → Reports UI sends report parameters to /api/reports/generate → Reports API queries Site Reports and Issue Logs Stores, generates report (PDF/CSV), returns file URL or stream → UI provides download link.

Background job runs daily → Alert Generation Job queries Site Reports and Issue Logs Stores → Analyzes data for recruitment shortfalls, protocol deviations, operational risks → Generates alerts in Alerts Store.
validationRules: Uploaded site data files must be CSV or XLSX format with required fields: siteId, studyId, reportDate, recruitmentCount.
RecruitmentCount must be a non-negative integer; retentionRate and protocolAdherenceScore if present must be numbers between 0 and 100.
SiteMetadata updates require valid siteId; coordinators and equipmentList must be valid JSON arrays or objects.

IssueLog submissions require issueId (unique), siteId, reportedDate, and description; severity if present must be one of predefined levels (e.g., low, medium, high); status if present must be from allowed statuses (e.g., open, in-progress, resolved).
Alert acknowledgement requires valid alertId and boolean resolved status; resolutionDate must be provided if resolved is true.
API query parameters for siteId, studyId, and date ranges must be validated for format and existence.
User authentication and role-based access control enforced on all protected routes and APIs.
File uploads must be scanned for size limits and basic content validation to prevent malformed or malicious files.
errorHandling: API endpoints return structured error responses with HTTP status codes (400 for validation errors, 401 for unauthorized, 404 for not found, 500 for server errors).
Upload API returns detailed validation feedback indicating row-level or field-level errors in uploaded files.
APIs handle missing or incomplete query parameters with clear error messages.
Background job logs errors and skips problematic data gracefully without halting entire job execution.
UI displays user-friendly error messages and retry options on API failures.
Race conditions on metadata edits handled via optimistic concurrency control or last-write-wins with user warnings.
Duplicate issue logs detected by unique issueId and rejected with informative error.
Unauthorized access attempts return 401 or 403 with no sensitive data exposure.
securityNotes: All API routes require user authentication; session or token-based auth enforced.
Role-based access control restricts data entry and metadata updates to authorized site coordinators and managers.
File uploads sanitized and validated to prevent injection or upload of malicious files.
Sensitive data access limited to authorized users; data filtering applied server-side.
Rate limiting and input sanitization applied to APIs to prevent abuse.
Audit logging for critical actions like alert acknowledgements and metadata changes.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communication.
Ensure proper CORS policies for API endpoints.

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in user with appropriate role
acceptanceTests.when: They upload a valid CSV site report file with required fields
acceptanceTests.then: The system validates, normalizes, stores the data and returns success confirmation with no errors

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in user on the dashboard page
acceptanceTests.when: They apply filters for study, site, and date range
acceptanceTests.then: The dashboard displays updated charts, tables, and alerts matching the filters

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in user submits an issue log with missing required fields
acceptanceTests.when: They send the issue log data to the API
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns validation errors specifying missing fields and the log is not stored

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in user views alerts and acknowledges one
acceptanceTests.when: They mark the alert as resolved
acceptanceTests.then: The alert status updates in the database and UI reflects the resolved state

acceptanceTests.given: A scheduled daily alert generation job runs
acceptanceTests.when: Site data and issue logs are available
acceptanceTests.then: Alerts are generated for recruitment shortfalls and protocol deviations and stored in Alerts Store

acceptanceTests.given: A user without proper authorization tries to access /data-entry/manual
acceptanceTests.when: They attempt to submit metadata or issue logs
acceptanceTests.then: The system denies access with 403 Forbidden error

acceptanceTests.given: A user requests a report generation with valid parameters
acceptanceTests.then: The system generates the report and provides a downloadable PDF or CSV file

acceptanceTests.given: A user uploads a data file with inconsistent or missing fields
acceptanceTests.when: The file is processed by the upload API
acceptanceTests.then: The system returns detailed validation errors and does not store invalid data

buildOrder: Define Prisma data models for SiteReport, SiteMetadata, IssueLog, Alert
Implement API routes for site-data upload and query
Implement API routes for site-metadata GET and update
Implement API routes for issue-logs POST
Implement API routes for alerts GET and acknowledge POST
Implement API route for reports generation POST
Build Data Entry UI pages (/data-entry/upload, /data-entry/manual) with forms and file upload
Build Dashboard UI page (/dashboard) with filtering and visualization components
Build Alerts UI page (/alerts) with alert list and acknowledgement controls
Build Reports UI page (/reports) with report parameter selection and download
Implement background job for daily alert generation
Add authentication and role-based access control middleware
Add validation and error handling logic across APIs and UI
Implement acceptance tests and perform end-to-end testing

nextPrompts.title: Planner: refine requirements
nextPrompts.purpose: Clarify and gather any missing or ambiguous constraints and requirements for the multi-site research data tracker.

nextPrompts.title: Architect: finalize pages + data models
nextPrompts.purpose: Define the final page routes, UI components, and data models for the tracker based on refined requirements.

nextPrompts.title: Builder: generate page stubs
nextPrompts.purpose: Generate code stubs for the UI pages and basic API routes based on the finalized architecture.

nextPrompts.title: Integrator: wire pages -> API -> DB
nextPrompts.purpose: Connect the UI pages to API endpoints and database models, ensuring data flow and validation are implemented end-to-end.
